intro: Uragoga granadensis, commonly known as the Granada thornapple, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
